title: Bayesian Model Selection under Constraints
text: re-generate R/rstanmodel.R C++ Source Code src use `rstantools::rstan_config() Next, execute ./createMakeVars script. step essential ensure devtools::check() functions correctly. can install compile package e.g. devtools::load_all()

title: S4 class for constrained linear regression models — ConstrainedLinReg-class
text: formula model formula (class formula) hasIntercept logical: model formula include intercept? scaleCenter numeric: location scale betas scaleScale numeric: scale scale betas cLevel numeric: desired credible level type character: regression type: "linear" "logistic" catVars character: names categorical variables designMatrix data.frame: design matrix Loo numeric: Leave-one-cross-validation WAIC numeric: Widely applicable information criterion df numeric: df nagelkerke numeric: Nagelkerke's R^2 MallowsCP numeric: Mallows' Cp AIC numeric: Akaike information criterion AICc numeric: Corrected Akaike information criterion BIC numeric: Bayesian information criterion AUC numeric: Area curve Rsq numeric: R^2 RsqAdj numeric: adjusted R^2 Bayes_Rsq numeric: Bayesian R^2 varNames character: variable names model_name character: name Stan model model_pars character: parameters Stan model par_dims list: dimensions parameters mode integer: mode sampler sim list: simulation data inits list: initial values sampling stan_args list: arguments passed Stan model stanmodel list: compiled Stan model date character: date model creation ar1 logical: whether AR(1) structure present scaleYCenter numeric: location scale Y variable scaleYScale numeric: scale scale Y variable

what: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
title: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
text: Model selection algorithm constrained estimation

title: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
code: constrSelEst(   formula,   data,   mustInclude = "",   mustExclude = "",   categorical = "",   maxExponent = 1,   inverseExponent = 1,   interactionDepth = 1,   intercept = TRUE,   constraint_1 = FALSE,   ar1 = FALSE,   yUncertainty = rep(0, NROW(data)),   xUncertainty = NULL,   xCatUncertainty = NULL,   type = "linear",   maxNumTerms = 10,   scale = TRUE,   chains = 4,   burnin = 300,   iterations = 500,   shiny = FALSE,   imputeMissings = FALSE )

title: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
text: formula formula object: formula object without exponents interactions. formula class formula, turned one. data data.frame: dataset mustInclude character vector: variables include case; use ":" interactions "(..)" powers, e.g.: "(x1^2):(x2^3)". mustExclude character vector: variables exclude case; use ":" interactions "(..)" powers, e.g.: "(x1^2):(x2^3)". categorical character vector: categorical variables maxExponent positive integer: highest exponent included formula. Default 1, e.g., linear effects. inverseExponent positive integer: highest inverse exponent included formula. Default 1, e.g., linear effects. interactionDepth positive integer: maximum order interaction. Default 1, e.g., main effects (interactions). intercept logical: intercept included estimation ? constraint_1 logical: beta variables add 1? ar1 logical: AR1 parameter included correlated errors? yUncertainty numeric vector: optional, uncertainties y variable given standard deviations xUncertainty data.frame: optional, uncertainties x variables. variable names must match names formula xCatUncertainty data.frame: optional, uncertainties categorical x variables. variable names must match names formula type character: regression type: "linear" "logistic" maxNumTerms positive integer: maximum number variables include scale logical: variables scaled mean 0 sd 1? chains positive integer: number chains MCMC sampling burnin burnin iterations positive integer: number iterations per chain MCMC sampling shiny logical: Used shiny? imputeMissings boolean: impute missings pmm method mice package?

title: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
text: list potential models

title: Model selection algorithm for constrained estimation — constrSelEst
code: if (FALSE) { suppressWarnings(RNGversion("3.5.0")) set.seed(44) n <- 80 x1 <- rnorm(n, sd = 1) x2 <- rnorm(n, sd = 1) x3 <- rnorm(n, sd = 1) y <- 0.4 + 0.3 * x1 + 0.3 * x1 * x3 + 0.4 * x1 ^ 2 * x2 ^ 3 + rnorm(n, sd = 0.3) yUncertainty <- rexp(n, 10) * 0.01 #optional (slow) #xUncertainty <- data.frame(x3 = rep(0.1, n), x1 = rep(0.1, n), x2 = rep(1, n)) data <- data.frame(x1, x2, x3, y, yUncertainty) models <- constrSelEst(y ~ x1 + x2 + x3, mustInclude = "x1", maxExponent = 3,                        interactionDepth = 3, intercept = TRUE,                        constraint_1 = TRUE, data = data,                        yUncertainty = yUncertainty,                        xUncertainty = NULL,                        maxNumTerms = 10) plotModelFit(models$models) bestModel <- getBestModel(models$models, thresholdSE = 2) print(bestModel) }

what: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
title: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
text: Creates formula interactions polynomials desired order. input formula already includes interactions, exponents functions (e.g., sqrt), ignored.

title: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
code: createFormula(   formula,   maxExponent = 1,   inverseExponent = 1,   interactionDepth = 1,   intercept = TRUE,   categorical = "",   mustExclude = "" )

title: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
text: formula formula object: formula object without exponents interactions. formula class formula, turned one. maxExponent positive integer: highest exponent included formula. Default 1, e.g., linear effects. inverseExponent positive integer: highest inverse exponent included formula. Default 1, e.g., linear effects. interactionDepth positive integer: maximum order interaction. Default 1, e.g., main effects (interactions). intercept logical: include intercept ? categorical character: categorical variables mustExclude character: variables exclude

title: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
text: formula containing original independent variables polynomials interactions.

title: Create a formula with interactions and polynomials up to a desired order — createFormula
code: createFormula("y ~ x1 + x2", 2, 3) #> y ~ x1 + x2 + I(x1^2) + I(x2^2) + I(x1^-2) + I(x2^-2) + I(x1^-3) +  #>     I(x2^-3) #> <environment: 0x557641eee618> createFormula(as.formula("y ~ x1 + x2"), interactionDepth = 2) #> y ~ x1 + x2 + x1:x2 #> <environment: 0x557641d32698>  carFormula <- createFormula("mpg ~ cyl + disp + drat", 2, 3) summary(lm(carFormula, mtcars)) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = carFormula, data = mtcars) #>  #> Residuals: #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -3.4685 -1.4968 -0.1371  1.4470  3.8022  #>  #> Coefficients: (2 not defined because of singularities) #>               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)   #> (Intercept) -1.764e+03  1.483e+03  -1.189   0.2476   #> cyl          2.973e+00  4.243e+00   0.701   0.4913   #> disp         1.833e-01  9.901e-02   1.852   0.0782 . #> drat         4.624e+02  4.012e+02   1.153   0.2620   #> I(cyl^2)    -4.260e-01  3.627e-01  -1.174   0.2533   #> I(disp^2)   -2.616e-04  1.243e-04  -2.105   0.0475 * #> I(drat^2)   -3.628e+01  3.223e+01  -1.126   0.2731   #> I(cyl^-2)           NA         NA      NA       NA   #> I(disp^-2)   3.450e+05  2.743e+05   1.258   0.2223   #> I(drat^-2)   1.204e+04  9.648e+03   1.248   0.2257   #> I(cyl^-3)           NA         NA      NA       NA   #> I(disp^-3)  -1.312e+07  1.510e+07  -0.869   0.3949   #> I(drat^-3)  -1.754e+04  1.368e+04  -1.282   0.2139   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 2.178 on 21 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.9116,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.8694  #> F-statistic: 21.64 on 10 and 21 DF,  p-value: 7.297e-09 #>

title: BMSC version 23.01.1
text: Add inverse exponents features. Now one can add x^-1, x^-2,.. potential modelling features Model averaging added. Now models can averaged criterion (AIC, AICc, WAIC, logLik, BIC Loo) Imputation missing values added (multiple imputation via mice package)
